SEARCH
Package grafioschtrader.security

Class TokenAuthenticationService

java.lang.Object
grafiosch.security.TokenAuthentication
grafioschtrader.security.TokenAuthenticationService
@Service public class TokenAuthenticationService extends TokenAuthentication
JWT token authentication service implementation for GrafioschTrader application.

This service extends the base TokenAuthentication class to provide application-specific authentication and configuration functionality. It handles JWT token validation for both HTTP requests and WebSocket connections, and provides comprehensive configuration data tailored for the trading application.

Authentication Support:

  • HTTP Authentication: Standard JWT token validation for REST APIs
  • WebSocket Authentication: STOMP header-based token validation
  • Configuration Delivery: Trading-specific frontend configuration

Configuration Features:

Provides specialized configuration data including currency precision settings, feature toggles for partially implemented functionality, supported cryptocurrencies, and field size constraints specific to the trading application.

  • Method Details

    • generateAuthenticationFromStompHeader

      public org.springframework.security.core.Authentication generateAuthenticationFromStompHeader(org.springframework.messaging.Message<?> message, org.springframework.messaging.simp.stomp.StompHeaderAccessor accessor)
      Generates authentication from STOMP WebSocket connection headers.

      This method handles JWT token authentication for WebSocket connections using STOMP protocol. It extracts the authentication token from the native headers and validates it to create an Authentication object for WebSocket session security.

      Usage:

      Used by WebSocket interceptors and handlers to authenticate STOMP connections, enabling secure real-time communication for trading data, notifications, and live updates.

      Parameters:
      message - the WebSocket message containing connection information
      accessor - STOMP header accessor for extracting authentication headers
      Returns:
      Authentication object if token is valid, null if authentication fails

    • getConfigurationWithLogin

      public ConfigurationWithLogin getConfigurationWithLogin(boolean uiShowMyProperty, String mostPrivilegedRole, boolean passwordRegexOk)
      Description copied from class: TokenAuthentication
      Creates configuration data for successful login responses.

      Abstract method that must be implemented by subclasses to provide application-specific configuration data that clients need after successful authentication. This typically includes user preferences, application settings, and frontend configuration.

      Specified by:
      getConfigurationWithLogin in class TokenAuthentication
      Parameters:
      uiShowMyProperty - flag indicating user's UI property display preference
      mostPrivilegedRole - the user's highest privilege role for authorization
      passwordRegexOk - flag indicating if user's password meets current requirements
      Returns:
      configuration object containing login and application setup data
